Great work!

![844f63f675_ar5_V200_vulcain_esa_corvaja.jpg](http://fr.cdn.v5.futura-sciences.com/builds/images/thumbs/8/844f63f675_ar5_V200_vulcain_esa_corvaja.jpg)

That's an awesome image I have to say!

BTW liquidhype, I can't give you rep...I'll have to spread it a bit around before giving it to you again, sorry! ![:(](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_sad.gif)

Will you'll also make the earlier Ariane's? That'd be so awesome!

> BTW liquidhype, I can't give you rep...I'll have to spread it a bit around before giving it to you again, sorry! ![:(](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_sad.gif)
> 
> Will you'll also make the earlier Ariane's? That'd be so awesome!

Yes I was thinking about making them. After Ariane 5 ECA and ES are done, I might finally finish up ULAs Vulcan. I've been pushing back the development of the Vulcan because of lack of specs. After Vulcan is done, I'm unsure of which launcher(s) to do next, so I might just go ahead and make Ariane 1,2,3 and 4.

You are welcome, thank you to share your work!

There is also the ariane 5 user's manual (in case you want to launch your own satellite ![:P](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_tongue.gif)):

[http://www.arianespace.com/launch-services-ariane5/Ariane5_users_manual_Issue5_July2011.pdf](http://www.arianespace.com/launch-services-ariane5/Ariane5_users_manual_Issue5_July2011.pdf)

**Edited <time datetime="2015-09-09T00:02:00Z" title="09/09/2015 12:02  AM" data-short="8 yr">September 9, 2015</time> by Skalou**

> 
> You are welcome, thank you to share your work!
> There is also the ariane 5 user's manual (in case you want to launch your own satellite ![:P](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_tongue.gif)):

Yes, I actually have that PDF file already, but thank you anyways ^^
If you REALLY want to put off development of Vulcain, why not try your hand at a Titan 4-Centaur T? ![:P](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_tongue.gif)

> 
> If you REALLY want to put off development of Vulcain, why not try your hand at a Titan 4-Centaur T? ![:P](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_tongue.gif)

I dont want to put off development of Vulcan, I've made most of the models and some of the textures. But I don't feel like releasing it when I am unsure of its specs. As for Titan, I might very well make a couple of Titans down the line, but first I need to finish up Ariane 5 ECA and ES.

I also really want to do the [Liberty launch vehicle](http://www.space.com/15625-liberty-rocket-private-space-taxi-atk.html) that was proposed a while back. It looks really cool ![:)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_smiley.gif)

> 
> I dont want to put off development of Vulcan, I've made most of the models and some of the textures. But I don't feel like releasing it when I am unsure of its specs. As for Titan, I might very well make a couple of Titans down the line, but first I need to finish up Ariane 5 ECA and ES.

By all means, finish up what you're working on!

But... come ooon...

Liberty is...ambitious, I'll say that, given Ares I's problems.

For Titan IV parts, see [http://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/threads/117844-Realism-Overhaul-Saab-s-Historical-Pack](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/threads/117844-Realism-Overhaul-Saab-s-Historical-Pack) ![:)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_smiley.gif)

It is an interesting consept. Or was an interesting consept.. But hey, the second best thing to having it in the real world is having it in KSP ![:)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_smiley.gif) Probably won't fit in the stock VAB, as it would have been roughly 90 meters tall, but it should feel right at home in RSS ![:)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_smiley.gif)

> 
> It is an interesting consept. Or was an interesting consept.. But hey, the second best thing to having it in the real world is having it in KSP ![:)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_smiley.gif) Probably won't fit in the stock VAB, as it would have been roughly 90 meters tall, but it should feel right at home in RSS ![:)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_smiley.gif)

 90 x 0.64 = 57.6, I think that a scaled-down Liberty would fit in the stock VAB.

> 
> 90 x 0.64 = 57.6, I think that a scaled-down Liberty would fit in the stock VAB.

When have I ever made a scaled down rocket? And even 57,6 meter is pushing it to the limit in the stock VAB. I am almost done with Ariane 5 ECA, which is 53 meters tall, and when I attach the fairings to it, they hit the VAB roof.

> 
> when have i ever made a scaled down rocket? And even 57,6 meter is pushing it to the limit in the stock vab. I am almost done with ariane 5 eca, which is 53 meters tall, and when i attach the fairings to it, they hit the vab roof.

big rockets =epic explosions

> 
> When have I ever made a scaled down rocket? And even 57,6 meter is pushing it to the limit in the stock VAB. I am almost done with Ariane 5 ECA, which is 53 meters tall, and when I attach the fairings to it, they hit the VAB roof.

 I meant like for stock KSP.
And there's always HangarExtender...

> 
> I meant like for stock KSP.
> And there's always HangarExtender...

If anyone wants to rescale my launchers for personal use, they are more than welcome to do so. Regardless, VAB size wont stop me from making whatever it is I want to make ![:P](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_tongue.gif)

> 
> If anyone wants to rescale my launchers for personal use, they are more than welcome to do so. Regardless, VAB size wont stop me from making whatever it is I want to make ![:P](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_tongue.gif)

Well spoken! ![:D](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_cheesy.gif)

**Status update:**

Getting ever closer to releasing the next update. I started off with just wanting to make Ariane 5 ECA and ES, but quickly realized there was much to be done with the older launchers as well. I've spent copious amounts of hours re-doing textures, making some new models for engines, upper stages etc, balancing the mod for Stock KSP and Career Mode and so on and so forth. The next version of this mod will be version 1.1 (because of KSP 1.1 hype) and will contain a whole bunch of upgrades and tweaks to the older launchers, as well as adding Ariane 5 ECA (for dual satellite launches) and Ariane 5 ES (with ATV). I may also do ETC, Real Plume and RO configs for all launchers. Every single change will be added to the changelog once the release is public. In the mean time, here is a imgur album with a couple of pictures of Ariane 5 ECA.

> [Javascript is disabled. View full album](//imgur.com/a/bSKXY)

> 
> **Status update:**
> Getting ever closer to releasing the next update. I started off with just wanting to make Ariane 5 ECA and ES, but quickly realized there was much to be done with the older launchers as well. I've spent copious amounts of hours re-doing textures, making some new models for engines, upper stages etc, balancing the mod for Stock KSP and Career Mode and so on and so forth. The next version of this mod will be version 1.1 (because of KSP 1.1 hype) and will contain a whole bunch of upgrades and tweaks to the older launchers, as well as adding Ariane 5 ECA (for dual satellite launches) and Ariane 5 ES (with ATV). I may also do ETC, Real Plume and RO configs for all launchers. Every single change will be added to the changelog once the release is public. In the mean time, here is a imgur album with a couple of pictures of Ariane 5 ECA.
> 
> [http://imgur.com/a/bSKXY](http://imgur.com/a/bSKXY)

Glad to hear... Looking good!!
That's really looking great, a huge jump ahead, if you compare Ariane now with the Vega! ![:)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_smiley.gif)
